channel.title: Your favorite IDE?
channel.description: What's your favorite Java IDE to use? I've been seeing more and more and I'm not exactly sure which one I should use.. Or should I just go simple and use Notepad++ ?

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Imperative, post:49, topic:399026”]As a Java newb, I used NetBeans. It had all my needs. I didn’t need any of Eclipse’s fancy shmancy plug-ins.
Then I encountered a little problem and I tried Eclipse. I thought it was perfect, and the UI made me glued to it.

As I became more advanced, I switched back over to NetBeans for GUI design and only ever used Eclipse for Android development.

Then, maybe sometime last month, as I was in the #rscode IRC, I learned about IntelliJ IDEA by JetBrains. super_ was so kind as to give me a working key, and then I was hooked. I’ve been using IDEA ever since, I personally think it’s great.[/quote]The only downside to IDEA is the half-assed UI designer. I use the JFormDesigner plugin instead, much nicer to work with.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @Imperative Imperative
item.description:
@Imperative wrote:

As a Java newb, I used NetBeans. It had all my needs. I didn’t need any of Eclipse’s fancy shmancy plug-ins.
Then I encountered a little problem and I tried Eclipse. I thought it was perfect, and the UI made me glued to it.

As I became more advanced, I switched back over to NetBeans for GUI design and only ever used Eclipse for Android development.

Then, maybe sometime last month, as I was in the #rscode IRC, I learned about IntelliJ IDEA by JetBrains. super_ was so kind as to give me a working key, and then I was hooked. I’ve been using IDEA ever since, I personally think it’s great.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

when making a intellij keygen set the major version to 16 and it will work on any version and any future updates will work fine, until it reaches version 16.

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @West7man West7man
item.description:
@West7man wrote:

IntelliJ. A few months ago I was a hardcore Eclipse user.
Everything else(ruby, html, php, …) I do with notepad++.
For c/c++ I use Visual.

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:43, topic:399026”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=496161.msg3630362#msg3630362 date=1308167771]

[/quote]
personally i hate using eclipse but atm i use it cause of android…what do you use?[/quote]

The few android apps I’ve developed already were done on eclipse because of the great integration, now I see that IDEA Community Edition supports android apps as well, but I haven’t got to test it yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Visual Studio 2010 for C/C++, EditPlus for everything else (Mainly being web development). When I have time to start looking at Java, I’m considering using IntelliJ IDEA, as I have never tried it before…

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @Protosstribe object
item.description:
@Protosstribe wrote:

I mainly use Eclipse for Java. But NetBeans 7.0 and IntelliJ IDEA are good aswell. At work I currently use NetBeans, but that’s for PHP (I personally think NetBeans 7.0 has better support for PHP than any Eclipse version I have used so far).

Also, there’s another version of Eclipse, called STS (SpringSource Tool Suite), that is very good for Enterprise Java development in general and Spring Framework in particular.

Read full topic

item.title: Your favorite IDE?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

The community version. It does everything I need it to do, so why bother going out of my way to use the paid version?

Also, now that C# has been dragged into the equation, Visual Studio is certainly superior to everything when it comes to building a GUI and also on par with IDEA in other areas.

Read full topic
